author: Mick Parr
comment: Update (the developer contacted me and explained the things I didn't understand how to use.  I am now much happier with the app.)  I think it works, but it's kinda confusing.  However, it's the only app I've found that runs on the watch itself.  Maybe it would be better if I used their launcher, but I don't want to.

reply.author: DYNA Logix
reply.content: Thank you for the feedback. Could you please email me which part of the app have you found confusing? I would love to fix/clarify. It's not ideal, but I try to explain things in the Play Store description + video. Have you seen those? How could I make the app less confusing? Was it that you looked for settings on the phone? email: bcwhelp@gmail.com

author: Steve Meiers
comment: The following link to the next few weeks ago but I don't think it would be a great day ahead of time and consideration of this email is strictly prohibited from disclosing this information to you and your team and we will have to be able to get back in town for work so far so good and bad news for

author: Kellie F.
comment: Great app. Wish I had space for it!

reply.author: DYNA Logix
reply.content: If you mean you don't have enough complication slots on your current watch face, I can recommend my other app, Bubble Cloud watch face launcher, which has space for"infinite" number of complications, since it allows watch face complications in the app drawer too. On the other hand Stand Up Alert also works well without its complication.

author: Billie York
comment: it will not uninstall

reply.author: DYNA Logix
reply.content: Pls email me if you have a problem: bcwhelp@gmail.com On older watches if you have a connectivity issue between watch and phone, the operating system might fail to remove watch component when uninstalled from phone. This is not my fault. Try to reinstall on phone, fix connection,then uninstall. On newer watches use Play Store on watch to uninstall.

author: M M
comment: Very good app to track steps and keep active and seamlessly integrates into the bubble wear app to show up on your watch face. Just works. 💪

reply.author: DYNA Logix
reply.content: To your health!

author: Uthamanathan nallasamy
comment: I had some issue initially BUT the Developer is too good and help me sort all the issues. This app is fantastic and for sure help all of us be active! Kudos to the app and the developer!!

reply.author: DYNA Logix
reply.content: Android Wear 2.0 apps are not pushed to watches anymore. You have to install them using the Play Store on the watch! If you open the app on your phone it will attempt to help you with it if there is a working connection to the watch. Email me for more help or a refund: bcwhelp@gmail.com Please remove negative review.

author: Dawei Yang
comment: Simply works. That's what I need.

author: Mister Junky
comment: This app is the very best!!!

reply.author: DYNA Logix
reply.content: Thank you Robert!

author: Jase Bleazard
comment: Great app! Devs read reviews and listen to comments!

reply.author: DYNA Logix
reply.content: I do :-) Thank you for all your feedback

author: Андрій
comment: Please update notification settings for alerting i.e. separate "not enough steps" and "steps limit reached".  Also sometimes it's not counting my steps and shows alert despite I took much more steps then needed.

reply.author: DYNA Logix
reply.content: Thank you for the feedback. I am interested in your suggestions. Pls email me with details. Do you mean you would like a notification card to show also when steps limit is reached? Or just a separate vibration? Which watch model are you using? I would very much like to investigate if there is a problem with registering steps. bcwhelp@gmail.com

author: Gergo Viczian
comment: I feel so much healthier already :-)

author: Joseph Rubin
comment: Yet another great addition to the greatest Wear App available! (Bubble Cloud) Oh.. And the customer support from this developer is second to none. If you don't like something just tell him,.if it makes sense he will most probably implement it. This guy is amazing!

author: Nancy Mueller
comment: I ONLY want to use the stand up reminder. But it seems I have to install the whole bubble launcher app and go through a lot more complexity than I want to.

reply.author: DYNA Logix
reply.content: You don't need Bubble Clouds for Stand up Alert to work. All the stand-up alert settings are on the watch (this is a standalone Wear 2.0 app). Only install Bubble Clouds if you want to control stand-up settings from your phone (btw you can keep Bubble Clouds disabled = set to "OFF"). Please email me for help (or refund) bcwhelp@gmail.com Thanks!

comment: Great update. Works reliably on AndroidWear 2.0. Keep up the good work. Love your bubble launcher too

author: Jill Rich
comment: Any chance you could add an option to disable the vibration that happens when you meet the step count? It can get really annoying sometimes.

reply.author: DYNA Logix
reply.content: Good point. Thank you for the suggestion. UPDATE: I have updated the app with separate controls for stand up alert and completion. Please update to version 2.12 with the new option. If you like it, please update your review, and enjoy the app!

title: Need to be able to disable notification on completion

author: Flemming Olesen
comment: Nice way to get a little nod when sitting to much.
title: Great app and use for Android Wear

author: Jonathan Ramos
comment: I like that it fulfils it's description of telling me to stand.

reply.author: DYNA Logix
reply.content: I hope it helps you live longer, healthier :-)

title: Awesome app

author: Darren Hall
comment: This does the job if the step counter is low. Really it should be in with android wear.

reply.author: DYNA Logix
reply.content: Darren, could you please email me with your suggestions on what would be a 5-star way to implement this. I did it the best I could, but please understand I never used an Apple Watch. Do you suggest I should not use the step counter? Or it should remind to stand regardless of the number of steps? My address is bcwhelp@gmail.com Thank you!

author: Nikita Hickson
comment: Great customer service!

author: Bradley Carter
comment: I love this app. It functions extremely well and it's intuitively designed. One feature I would like to see is the ability to automatically disable it on certain days of the week. While I find it great for the office during the week, I'd rather not be reminded of my inactivity while loafing on the weekends.

reply.author: DYNA Logix
reply.content: Good idea! UPDATE: I added the days selector. Please update to v1.14 to get it. If using Bubble Clouds, update that to version 5 too!

title: Great app for anyone with a desk job!

author: John Salinas
comment: So far so good. Reminders work. Does what it say. Looking forward to its future features!! A must have for desk jockeys or people trying to get into better health.

reply.author: DYNA Logix
reply.content: I am testing the new day selector by having it automatically disabled for today. It is very strange to work and not be reminded to stand up. I got used to the periodic reminders, I miss them now. If the new version passes the test on both of my test devices I am releasing it. It will work stand-alone or with the beta version of Bubbles v4.99.

author: Daniel Estrada
comment: Add a little widget that shows steps. I saw the blue alert indicator with the bubbles but I didn't want to download that because it looks a bit too much. I'd like a small little indicator that sits on top of my watch face wallpaper. Thanks!

reply.author: DYNA Logix
reply.content: Good idea. This way it would be compatible with any watch-face. I will see what I can do. Thank you!

title: Cool app! Helps to get up from studying.

author: Goran Brkic
comment: Prety useful app, there is just one thing that should be improved.  - When I take off my watch, and it goes to stand-by mode, it is useless to notify me.

reply.author: DYNA Logix
reply.content: That's true. I found no way to detect if the watch is on your wrist or not (in a battery friendly manner). The app does detect if you put the watch on charger though. You will get only one notification when the watch is off your hand. Please email me at bcwhelp@gmail.com if you have a better suggestion, I would love to improve.

author: Michael Bourke
comment: And everything you do

reply.author: DYNA Logix
reply.content: Thank you Michael :) I love your profile pic

title: Love it

author: Photo And Web
comment: I purchased this new app originally to support the developer. But Standup Alert has grown on me! I haven't noticed the amount of time I spend sitting during my day. It does feel great to stretch my legs every hour or so. There are a few false alarms (once while driving, and yesterday in a supermarket [?!] maybe my watch didn't detect steps while pushing the cart?), but it never got irritating. The best thing that happened to my watch since Bubble Cliuds!

reply.author: DYNA Logix
reply.content: Thanks! I am working on reducing those false alarms. Try lowering the minimum step count for the hour.

title: Useful

author: Gerald Vegas
comment: Great app to keep you active through the day. Had a small issue with the app and sent a mail to the developer who replied back amazingly quickly and solved the issue. Can't ask for more.
title: Developer support second to none

author: James Steed
comment: Not really impressed. It will work when you tell it too but seems to vibrate randomly without showing any kind of notification and has no sound option nor does it respond to override apps like Feel the Wear. If you want to control it from your phone you have to install another app that has the potential to over-ride the native 2.0 interface and control.

reply.author: DYNA Logix
reply.content: This is a standalone watch app. Have you checked the settings on the watch? You can set whether you want notification or not. You can set how much vibration you want. How frequently. The minimum number of steps before notification. Please watch the 2nd half of the Play Store video and read description. Email me if you have any questions, I respond.

author: Trevor Simpson
comment: What I was looking for was an actual step counter that worked stand alone with my phone. as an added widget on the bubble launcher. Maybe an idea for another app.

reply.author: DYNA Logix
reply.content: Could be. Thanks for the suggestion. But please rate my app based on whether it fulfills its description or not. This is a stand-up alert app, which hopefully works reliably on your watch. If this is not the functionality you were after, you can reach me over email, I always give refunds without questions, but please don't down rate :-(

title: Step COUNTER?
